repo.description: The most widely used Python to C compiler
repo.name: cython

comment_data.body:
```suggestion
PYTHON -c "import pkg.A"
PYTHON setup.py build_ext --inplace
```

For these tests where we're aiming to match the behaviour to Python we often try to run the test in Python too.

```suggestion
        module_dot = PyUnicode_Concat(module_name, PYUNICODE("."));
```

This is a shortcut Cython supports for utility code for Unicode constants - it gets substituted when the source file is generated and just avoids you having to manage them manually. You then don't need to manage `PyObject *dot` (so can remove some of your lines above)

It looks like this requires a somewhat recent version of Python for the Python tests to work. (It's not a concern for the Cython side of it)

```suggestion
PYTHON -c "import sys; if sys.version_info >= (3,5): import pkg.A"
```
Looks like the presence of pkg/__init__.py causes the problem for some reason (but it didn't seem to be a problem in the first round of commits).

```suggestion
from . import B

def verify(rel_B):
    import pkg.B
    assert pkg.B == rel_B

verify(B)
```
comment_data.diff_hunk:
@@ -0,0 +1,24 @@
+PYTHON -c 'if __import__("sys").version_info >= (3,5): import pkg.A'
+PYTHON setup.py build_ext --inplace
+PYTHON -c "import pkg.A"
+
+######## setup.py ########
+
+from Cython.Build.Dependencies import cythonize
+from distutils.core import setup
+
+setup(
+    ext_modules = cythonize("**/*.py"),
+    )
+
+######## pkg/__init__.py ########
+
+######## pkg/A.py ########
+from . import B
+
+######## pkg/B.py ########
+from . import C
+
+######## pkg/C.py ########
+from . import B

comment_data.body: I don't think this test can work (hence it fails on pure Python too) - the contents of `B` aren't filled in until after module `C` has run fully. I think maybe you should call verify up in the `PYTHON -c ...` lines after the import statement has completed fully.
comment_data.diff_hunk:
@@ -16,9 +16,25 @@ setup(
 ######## pkg/A.py ########
 from . import B
 
+def verify(rel_B):
+    import pkg.B
+    assert pkg.B == rel_B
+verify(B)
+
 ######## pkg/B.py ########
 from . import C
 
+def verify(rel_C):
+    import pkg.C
+    assert pkg.C == rel_C
+verify(C)
+
 ######## pkg/C.py ########
 from . import B
 
+def verify(rel_B):
+    import pkg.B
+    assert pkg.B == rel_B
+
+verify(B)

comment_data.body:
Interesting. I would have expected that to work…

Anyway, what I wanted to assure is that `__Pyx_Import()` returns the module and not the package.

I'm not even sure that we need `__Pyx_Import()` here. A lookup in `sys.modules` might be enough. Didn't take the time to dig up what exactly Python is doing here – in any case, we should mimic that.
comment_data.diff_hunk:
@@ -16,9 +16,25 @@ setup(
 ######## pkg/A.py ########
 from . import B
 
+def verify(rel_B):

+    assert pkg.B == rel_B
+verify(B)
+
 ######## pkg/B.py ########

+

+    assert pkg.B == rel_B
+
+verify(B)

comment_data.body:
Having tested it in more detail: I think I misrepresented the problem with these tests slightly. It's actually that the contents of `pkg` aren't filled in until all its submodules are successfully imported

As you suspect, Python is just looking up in `sys.modules` - https://github.com/python/cpython/commit/0373a106a1ca9ce67cd99bf0a93ab7c3abd15cb6 (that's the implementation from 3.5 but the current version isn't notably different) so it's probably worth simplifying to that

+

 from . import B

+
+verify(B)

comment_data.body:
```suggestion
            value = PyObject_GetItem(modules, full_name);
```

I genuinely don't understand why, but this seems to make it pass on Python 3.6 (for me at least)
The reason is that `__Pyx_PyDict_GetItemStr()` assumes a known string hash value (usually for a literal string). Here, we are creating a new string for the FQMN before we call it. That's a bug.

commit.message: Use a lookup in sys.modules instead of a full import for the submodule. This is what CPython does.

verification.payload:
tree ea696ff61c150413ecba68245354d5cb2f47d77b
parent 5ce53bf526cdb9b56fe8258acabdcdb2e49dd304
author scoder <stefan_ml@behnel.de> 1639559547 +0100
committer GitHub <noreply@github.com> 1639559547 +0100

Use a lookup in sys.modules instead of a full import for the submodule. This is what CPython does.

milestone.description:
Goals:
– New version scheme: 3.x instead of 0.x.
– Change default `language_level` from `2` to `3`.
– Change default for `binding` directive from `False` to `True`.
– Fix some Python compatibility issues (if possible, allowing for breaking changes).

title: Add partial circular import fix (and test) for #4390
